name: Robert Baratheon
text: Renown. Reaction: After the standing phase begins (choose one): - other characters with printed cost 5 or higher cannot stand this phase. - characters with printed cost 4 or lower cannot stand this phase. - locations cannot stand this phase.

flavor: "I never asked for this crown."
name: Stannis Baratheon
text: Immune to opponents' events. Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, draw X cards. X is the claim value on the attacking player's revealed plot card.

name: Melisandre
text: Stealth. Reaction: After you win an [intrigue] challenge in which Melisandre is attacking, move 1 power from a character controlled by the losing opponent to Melisandre. Then, if that character has no power, kill it.

flavor: "Tyrell swords will make me king."
name: Renly Baratheon
text: Renown. Action: Kneel your faction card to put a non-[baratheon] character with printed cost X or lower into play from your hand. X is Renly Baratheon's STR.

flavor: "Good ser, it is gold I crave, not words on papers."
name: Salladhor Saan
text: Reaction: After you marshal a Smuggler character, choose and kneel a location. Then, gain gold equal to that location's printed cost. (Limit once per round.)

name: Ser Davos Seaworth
text: Stealth. Reaction: After you win a challenge in which Ser Davos Seaworth is participating, discard 1 power from the losing opponent's faction card. Then, you may have a King character you control gain 1 power.

flavor: "Stannis Baratheon will never sit the Iron Throne. Is it treason to say the truth? A bitter truth, but no less true for that."
name: Alester Florent
text: Reaction: After a House Florent character enters play, draw a card. (Limit once per round.) Interrupt: When Alester Florent leaves play, if you control another R'hllor character, choose and kneel a character an opponent controls.

flavor: "A queen should be a mistress beneath her own roof."
name: Selyse Baratheon
text: Reduce the cost of each R'hllor attachment you marshal by 3.

flavor: Griffin's Roost was strong but small...
name: Griffin's Roost Knight
text: Interrupt: When the challenges phase ends, if you have not lost a [power] challenge this phase, stand Griffin's Roost Knight.

flavor: "Your son Dale will go south in Wraith, past Cape Wrath and the Broken Arm, all along the coast of Dorne as far as the Arbor." <cite>Stannis Baratheon</cite>
name: Dale Seaworth
text: Reaction: After you marshal Dale Seaworth, choose a [baratheon] location in your discard pile and return it to your hand.

flavor: With four times as many ships as the boy king, Ser Imry saw no need for caution or deceptive tactics.
name: Ser Imry Florent
text: Action: Kill Ser Imry Florent to choose an opponent. You may sacrifice any number of locations. For each location sacrificed this way, that opponent must choose and kneel a standing character he or she controls.

flavor: The red priest lit their fires every day at sunset, to thank R'hllor for the day just ending, and beg him to send his sun back on the morrow to banish the gathering darkness.
name: Red Priest
text: Reaction: After Red Priest enters play, look at an opponent's hand. Then, choose 1 card in that hand and remove it from the game until Red Priest leaves play.

name: Shyra Errol
text: Interrupt: When a character is killed, sacrifice Shyra Errol to move each power from that character to its controller's faction card.

flavor: "Any cat may stare into a fire and see red mice at play." <cite>Melisandre</cite>
name: Acolyte of the Flame
text: Reaction: After the draw phase begins, kneel Acolyte of the Flame to look at the top 2 cards of an opponent's deck. You may put those cards on the bottom of that player's deck.

flavor: "If you bed enough women, some will give you presents, and His Grace has never been shy on that count." <cite>Littlefinger</cite>
name: Bastard of Robert
text: While you control Robert Baratheon, reduce the cost to marshal Bastard of Robert by 2. Reaction: After Bastard of Robert enters play, if you control a King character, draw a card.

flavor: A smuggler had best know men as well as tides, or he would not live to smuggle long.
name: Wily Smuggler
text: Action: Choose 1 card from your hand and place it on top of your deck. Then, at the end of the phase, draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: The Stormlands
text: You may initiate an additional [power] challenge during the challenges phase. Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, kneel The Stormlands to choose and stand a participating King or Queen character.

flavor: ...he would never have dared attempt a landing on Cape Wrath; the storm lords were too fiercely loyal to House Baratheon and to King Robert.
name: Cape Wrath
text: During [power] challenges in which you are the attacking or defending player, raise the claim value on the attacking player's revealed plot card by 1.

flavor: One of Salladhor Saan's warships was sweeping past the castle, her gaily striped hull slicing through the greygreen waters as her oars rose and fell.
name: Lyseni Galley
text: Action: Kneel Lyseni Galley to choose a character. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +1 STR. If that character is a Captain or Smuggler, it gains stealth until the end of the phase.

name: Azor Ahai Reborn
text: Unique character you control only. Terminal. Attached character is considered to be participating in each challenge in which you control an attacking R'hllor character.

flavor: "He slew the boar. His entrails were sliding from his belly, yet somehow he slew the boar." <cite>Renly Baratheon</cite>
name: Hunting Accident
text:
Ambush (3). Terminal.
Attached character cannot stand.

flavor: He'd had a giant's strength too, his weapon of choice a spiked iron warhammer that Ned could scarcely lift.
name: Warhammer
text:
If attached character's printed STR is 4 or lower, it gets +2 STR.
If attached character's printed STR is 5 or higher, it gains intimidate.

name: "A Cask of Ale"
text: Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, choose 2 cards controlled by the same player. Move up to 2 power from one of those cards to the other.

name: Nightfire Visions
text: Play only if you control a R'hllor character. Taxation Action: Name a Trait. If an opponent reveals a plot card with that Trait during the next plot phase, draw 3 cards.

name: Botley Crew
text: Reaction: After an opponent collects income, return 1 gold from that player's gold pool to the treasury.

flavor: ...it was small wonder they named the islands the land of ten thousand kings.
name: Every Captain is a King
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Captain character you control gains the King trait and does not kneel when declared as an attacker in [power] challenges.

flavor: "Gregor is a very large man. Also a very stupid one. Too stupid to know when he should die, it seems." <cite>Cersei Lannister</cite>
name: Ser Gregor Clegane
text: Intimidate. Pillage. Forced Reaction: After you win a challenge in which Ser Gregor Clegane is participating, choose and kill a character you control.

flavor: Her hull was black and gold, her figurehead a lion with an upraised paw.
name: Lionstar
text: Action: Kneel Lionstar to put a [lannister] character with printed cost 4 or lower into play from your hand. At the end of the phase, if that card is still in play, discard it from play.

name: Prince's Attendant
text: Marshaling Action: Kneel Prince's Attendant to reduce the cost of the next [martell] Lord or Lady character you marshal this phase by 2.

name: Kingsgrave
text: Reaction: After you lose a [power] challenge by 5 or more STR, kneel and sacrifice Kingsgrave to choose a participating character and return it to its owner's hand. (You may kill that character instead if it has the King trait.) Errata from FAQ v2.2

flavor: "Oh, eight thousand years is a good while, to be sure... yet if the Night's Watch does not remember, who will?" <cite>Old Bear Mormont</cite>
name: Protectors of the Realm
text:
No attachments.
X is your reserve value.

flavor: "They never blow three. Not for hundreds and thousands of years. Three means —" <cite>Samwell Tarly</cite>
name: The Horn that Wakes the Sleepers
text: Reaction: After an opponent initiates a challenge against you, choose and stand a Builder character, a Ranger character, and a Steward character.

flavor: "You are braver than I am, I fear. Are all your Bear Island women such warriors?" <cite>Catelyn Stark</cite>
name: She-Bear
text: Reaction: After you marshal She-Bear, you may put a [stark] character or attachment with printed cost 3 or lower into play from your hand.

flavor: "A woman in a bearskin, with a child in one arm suckling her breast. In the other hand she holds a battleaxe. She's no proper lady, that one, but I always loved her." <cite>Dacey Mormont</cite>
name: Bearskin Cloak
text: Attached character gets +1 STR. If attached character has the House Mormont trait, it gains stealth.

flavor: ...Haggo, huge and silent, often glowered...
name: Haggo
text: Reaction: After you win a challenge in which Haggo is participating, discard a card from your hand to choose a Dothraki card in your discard pile and return it to your hand.

name: Dothraki Steed
text: Limit 1 copy per character. While attached character is attacking, it gets +1 STR (+3 STR instead if it has the Dothraki trait). Errata from FAQ v2.2

name: Hightower Knight
text: Action: Kneel a non-[tyrell] Knight character to put Hightower Knight into play from your hand.

flavor: "In Highgarden there are fields of golden roses that stretch away as far as the eye can see." <cite>Robert Baratheon</cite>
name: Fields of the Reach
text: Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, kneel 3 The Reach locations to raise the claim value on your revealed plot card by 1 until the end of the challenge.

flavor: "I have never taken kindly to chastisement, as any number of dead men could tell you."
name: Lyn Corbray
text: Stealth. Reaction: After an opponent initiates a [power] challenge against you, stand Lyn Corbray.

flavor: Near forty men took part, freeriders and hedge knights and new-made squires in search of a reputation.
name: Unlikely Champion
text: While you control a Lord or Lady character, Unlikely Champion gains a [power] icon.

flavor: That afternoon a boy named Anguy, an unheralded commoner from the Dornish Marches, won the archery competition, outshooting Ser Balon Swann and Jalabhar Xho at a hundred paces...
name: Anguy the Archer
text: While you control no loyal characters, Anguy the Archer does not kneel when declared as an attacker or defender in a [military] challenge.

flavor: "A refuge where neither wolves nor lions come prowling." <cite>Lem Lemoncloak</cite>
name: The Hollow Hill
text: Dominance Action: If you control no loyal characters, kneel The Hollow Hill to search the top 10 cards of your deck for a non-loyal character, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: "My lady has a thirst. Whenever she comes out to dance, she likes a drop of red." <cite>Lyn Corbray</cite>
name: Lady Forlorn
text:
Attached character gets +1 STR for each neutral location you control.
If attached character is Lyn Corbray, he gains a [power] icon.

flavor: "I thank you, my lords... but I spit upon your pity." <cite>Ser Barristan Selmy</cite>
name: Defiance
text: Challenges Action: Choose and stand a character that has not participated in a challenge this phase. (Max 1 per phase.)

name: The Prince that was Promised
text: After all agendas are announced, name a unique character. Other characters you control cannot gain power. Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge by 5 or more STR, kneel your faction card to, either: stand the named character and draw a card; or, search your deck, discard pile, and dead pile for the named character, reveal it, add it to your hand, and shuffle your deck.

name: Parley at Storm's End
text: When Revealed: Name a challenge type. Until you reveal a new plot card, challenges of that type cannot be initiated.

name: Outwit
text: Interrupt: When the effects of a when revealed ability would initiate, kneel your faction card and a unique Maester character to cancel those effects.

name: Siege Preparations
text: Dominance Action: Draw cards until your hand size is equal to your reserve value. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Rationing
text: Players cannot trigger reactions to winning or losing challenges.

name: Desperate Attack
text: While you are the defending player, raise the claim value on the attacking player's revealed plot card by 1.

name: The Hand's Tourney
text: Forced Interrupt: When claim is applied for a [military] challenge, apply [power] claim instead.

name: The New Gods
text: Each The Seven character you control does not kneel when declared as an attacker in the first challenge you initiate during the challenges phase.
